intro: Lomatophyllum roseum, commonly known as the pink ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling ghostly shapes, hence its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance make it a sought-after ornamental plant.
